comment:
-watch the lecture on the topic ( a PowerPoint presentation, equivalent to an audio explanation of problems ) 
- attempt hw ( Macmillan achieve)
- hw past the first question is much more advanced than the examples in the lecture 
- YouTube topic to actually learn 
- repeat

3 exams (45%) + final (40%) + quizzes (5%) + hw(10%)
exams/quizzes are mc
rating_tags: Clear grading criteria--Lots of homework--Test heavy

comment: Professor Pengcheng is just OK. I took him as a summer online class and his lectures were not very helpful. I used outside sources to learn everything. Clear syllabus, homework, 5 quizzes, 3 tests, final is worth 30% of grade. Chegg was a lifesaver for me and 100% worth the cost. He is a nice and caring guy, but be prepared to learn on your own.
rating_tags: Clear grading criteria--Lots of homework--Test heavy

comment: Professor Xiao is not bad at all. He knows what he's talking about but his powerpoints could be better. He explains very fast and shows many examples that are already worked out instead of doing them with the class. If you do the homework you will do well in the class as his quizzes and tests are of similar difficulty.
Calc 2 is hard in general so just be ready lol thats all I can say. If you dont know trig either than that also means ur cooked. IDK bro good luck

The worst professor I've had in the math department, his lectures are him just scrolling through the textbook and reading some parts and other times just pointing at something and saying "yeahh". Every time I went to office hours he shooed me out and said he was busy, this guy was genuinely terrible, wouldn't recommend him

I took him over the summer as an online class. Grades consist of 3 tests, final, quizzes, and HW. He has videos he made for class, they are average he just reads off a textbook instead of providing questions himself. He does supply other videos to watch. Nothing too hard. Tests are proctored and are around 16-18 questions.

5 quizzes, 3 tests, final, and group work. The group work was a packet you worked with people in class and it was pretty easy. He will answer any questions you have and is accessible outside of class. Test questions were from the homework he assigned; homework is not graded, but do it and you should get an A. Lectures were okay, just power points.

He's alright, his lectures are pretty hard to understand. He gets the examples from the textbook and most of them do not make much sense. I had to use other sources to understand most of the chapters.80% 3 tests and the final replaces the lowest test grade. The last 20% of the grade is the homework, unlimited tries so free 20%. Overall tough class.
rating_tags: EXTRA CREDIT--Test heavy--Graded by few things

comment: Quite a bit of homework, but a lot of it is good practice to prepare for tests. Unfortunately, not as much practice in class. Gives a lot of opportunities for students to make up points.

I'm not interested in calculus much and this professor didn't seem to care about the class either. I got the impression that he would rather not be there. His powerpoints are messy and long. The information could be condensed and presented in a more structured, easy to learn from way. Overall, I got the info I needed, but it was my worst class yet.
rating_tags: Lots of homework--Clear grading criteria--Lecture heavy

comment: Prof Xiao is a good choice for Calc 2. He is a good lecturer and answers questions well. The class has a lot of homework due each week on Pearson. The tests were fairly hard and had 15 questions with a 2 hour limit. 4 tests with the final. He gives partial credit for wrong answers if you made simple mistakes. I would recommend Prof Xiao.
rating_tags: Lots of homework--Test heavy--Clear grading criteria

comment: He gets a bit of a bad rep. He's a very by the book teacher and he gives 1-2 homework assignments due once a week, every week. But his tests are basically the homework. He posts YouTube videos to help prep for tests AND posts videos explaining test solutions. No curves or retakes but just attend the lectures/do homework/watch the videos to get an A
rating_tags: Gives good feedback--Lots of homework--Lecture heavy

comment: Calculus 2 is a tough class, but honestly with this professor it's 10x harder. He does not curve at all. The class average for the tests (1-3) were all in the 50's -70's. His lectures are unbearable. Just save yourself the trouble and take a professor for this class that curves because many of them do if the test averages are that low.

Taking him will only make it harder for yourself than it needs to be. He doesnt explain things in depth. He doesnt give curves or give the option to replace your lowest test grade with the Final, meaning that 1 bad test WILL RUIN YOU! I recommend taking another professor that does these things.
rating_tags: Graded by few things--Test heavy--Tough grader

comment: He teaches very clearly and tells you what you will be tested over. Do the homework. (He does not grade it but it helps.)

This professor is amazing. He taught at Arlington and Evansville before coming here. Homework is optional but is useful for doing well on tests and quizzes. He grades pretty fast too and gives some points even if you got the overall answer wrong. He reviews homework, quiz, and test questions during class too if you ask.
rating_tags: Accessible outside class--Skip class? You won't pass.--Amazing lectures

comment: His class is really lecture heavy and goes really fast. If this is your first calculus class, you might want to switch classes because his class is definitely difficult. If you already have experience with calculus, this class is perfect for honing your math skills. He goes over the most difficult questions on the HW and quiz which end up on tests.
rating_tags: Skip class? You won't pass.--Lecture heavy--Caring

comment: He creates his own tests that are much harder than other professor's tests. Questions on tests and quizzes are always much harder than any of the homework questions. He thinks his difficult multi-step derivatives should be done in 3 minutes or less. All tests are cumulative from beginning to the end of the semester.
rating_tags: Skip class? You won't pass.--Test heavy--Lecture heavy

comment: Would not take this professor again

Class was 8-9:40am, there were 5 random attendance checks throughout the semester. The class was Math 1190 (calc) so if you didn't attend class you wouldn't know how to do it. You could meet at his office if you didn't understand something. If your schedule is difficult he'll make time to meet. He's new but used to teach at other colleges.
rating_tags: Respected--Accessible outside class--Skip class? You won't pass.
